Class VehicleSprite

java.lang.Object
Launcher.VehicleSprite
public class VehicleSprite extends Object
Visual representation of a vehicle used by the Dashboard renderer.

A VehicleSprite holds the vehicle identity, its current position and animation state used to interpolate movement between points on the map. Instances are mutated by the UI thread (animation timer) and read by the renderer.

  • Constructor Details

    • VehicleSprite

      public VehicleSprite(String id, Vehicle vehicle, double x, double y)
      Create a new sprite anchored at the given coordinates.
      Parameters:
      id - textual id displayed on the map
      vehicle - domain vehicle object (provides `VehicleType` for styling)
      x - initial x coordinate (map space)
      y - initial y coordinate (map space)

  • Method Details

    • setTarget

      public void setTarget(double tx, double ty, long durationMs)
      Start moving the sprite toward the target coordinates.

      If the target is effectively the same as the current position the sprite will not be marked as moving.

      Parameters:
      tx - target x coordinate
      ty - target y coordinate
      durationMs - animation duration in milliseconds (values <= 0 are treated as 1ms)

    • markForRemoval

      public void markForRemoval()
      Mark this sprite for removal once it reaches its target.

      The renderer / controller will check shouldRemoveNow() to actually remove the sprite from the model.

    • shouldRemoveNow

      public boolean shouldRemoveNow()
      Returns true if the sprite was marked to be removed.

    • updatePosition

      public boolean updatePosition()
      Advance the internal animation state based on the current time.

      This method updates x, y and angle as the sprite interpolates toward the target. It returns true when a position update occurred (including the final arrival), or false when the sprite was not moving.

      Returns:
      true if the sprite position was updated

    • draw

      public void draw(Graphics2D g2)
      Draw the sprite onto the provided Graphics2D surface.

      The method uses the vehicle type (car, truck, motorcycle) to choose a fill color and draws a small rounded rectangle rotated according to the current angle. The vehicle id is rendered above the sprite.

      Parameters:
      g2 - graphics context (must not be null)
